CatDescriptText: Miss Cora Fitzgerald, Langley High School senior, 809 Whiteside Road, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should be 'militant' in their fight for civil rights or pursue a course of 'sitting down, talking and seeking a working plan for obtaining them without vigorous pressure?"Answer reads: "I think that the drive for equal rights should be on a conciliatory basis.  I think that if you try to force a person to do anything you will not succeed.  However, if you try to compromise, the other party will try to meet you half way, and in some cases better than half way."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Cora Fitzgerald, wearing dark zippered jacked with collar, carrying books and rolled paper package, standing in front of York Shop, Fifth Avenue, Downtown
